pageContext.claim: “The new governor [of California, Gavin Newsom], nice guy, yes, nice guy. When I'm with him face to face, nice. When he speaks about me, not so nice. But face to face, he loves me. Called me up he said, ‘You're a great president; you're doing a great job.’ He actually did two weeks ago to me so he'll probably deny it, but check the phone records at the White House. … Three or four weeks. … Let’s say four weeks ago or so. …  ‘I just want to tell you you're a great president. And you're one of the smartest people I've ever met.’ That's what he said. Now that's what he said. Will he admit it? No, I doubt it. But that's what he said.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often makes these evidence-free claims about adversaries praising him in private conversations. It's doubtful that Newsom, a Democrat who has called on Trump to resign, called him one of the smartest people he'd ever met and a great president.
